data.title: Graphics API agnostic headers
data.body:
This refactors the Graphics subdirectory headers to not use different versions based on the graphics API. This should make it possible to swap Urho3D library using whatever API in a client application, since the ABI should be the same in any case. Some API-specific functions are present in the headers, but these are explicitly marked, and should be a safe no-op when called on the "wrong" API.

In addition code duplication was reduced by moving common functionality into a separate .cpp file in Graphics directory, away from the API-specific .cpp files.

Testing is welcome, since this is quite a large change.

Note that three explicitly API-specific classes remain, but these are for internal use only and not needed in applications: GraphicsImpl, ShaderProgram, and VertexDeclaration.

data.body: Seems to be a subtle omission

data.title: fixes #1444
data.body: https://github.com/urho3d/Urho3D/issues/1444

data.title: MinGW: Redefinition of struct timespec
data.body:
I tried compiling Urho3D on Windows 7, and I ran into a compilation error on this line: https://github.com/urho3d/Urho3D/blob/master/Source/ThirdParty/Civetweb/src/civetweb.c#L329

I was able to fix it by changing it to this:

```
// Urho3D: fix VC15 compilation issue
#if defined(_MSC_VER) && (_MSC_VER >= 1900) 
#define _TIMESPEC_DEFINED
#endif
#if defined(__MINGW32__)
#define _TIMESPEC_DEFINED
#endif
#ifndef _TIMESPEC_DEFINED
struct timespec {
    time_t tv_sec; /* seconds */
    long tv_nsec;  /* nanoseconds */
};
#endif
```

data.title: 08 Decals now draws debug geometry
data.body:
`false` was being passed into the call do `drawDebugGeometry`, now
it's actually using the variable `drawDebug_`.

data.title: Take ownership of android.toolchain.cmake development
data.body:
[All done] This is a question and not necessarily becomes an issue that we need to solve (depends on the feedback). On one hand the development of this toolchain file seems to stale at the upstream. On the other hand, we have deviated more and more from the original version. Personally, I hate to add the "Urho3D" modification tags every time I need to change things, and I also found a few weirdness in that toolchain file that I am not able to fully explain. It is the most complicated toolchain file that we currently have. Our custom toolchain files are much straightforward in comparison. i.e. We may be paying the price of things that we don't actually need.

It is not a CMake standard module at any rate, so I don't think it is terribly wrong if we have our own custom Android toolchain file. We could still track the upstream changes, if any, even after we have developed our custom version, of course.

What say you?

data.title: bool Serializable::LoadXML(const XMLElement& source, bool setInstanceDefault) function doesn't parse AM_DEFAULT attributes
data.body:
Not sure if this is a bug or intended design, but the 
bool Serializable::LoadXML(const XMLElement& source, bool setInstanceDefault)
function does not parse AM_DEFAULT attributes and I'm having to duplicate the exact code in the derived class, e.g. Vehicle, with the AM_DEFAULT mask.

data.title: the MessageBox class asserts in c++ in the HandleMessageAcknowledged() function due to refCount = 0
Memory leak on Windows in Window mode
data.body:
Hi! I download Urho3D repository (master branch) week ago and now I find small memory leak in application window mode on my Windows 7 x64.
For clear expiriment I run 3 applications: Windowed Empty Application, Fullscreen Empty Application, HelloWorld Sample. After that I open task manager:

```
Windowed Empty Application memory: 22 164 kilobytes.
Fullscreen Empty Application memory: 11 140 kilobytes.
HelloWorld Sample memory: 30 176 kilobytes.
```

After 10 minutes:

```
Windowed Empty Application memory: 31 080 kilobytes.
Fullscreen Empty Application memory: 11 408 kilobytes.
HelloWorld Sample memory: 41 260 kilobytes.
```

Result: around 18 kilobytes per second memory leak.
I know that this memory leak is not very big and maybe is not critical. But I think it will be good if somebody fix it. :)

data.title: CMake ignored default build samples (off)
data.body:
The default building sample applications option (off) is ignored. I have to force set it to build with CMake `-DURHO3D_SAMPLES=0`, unless you already changed the default build option and have not updated the docs.

http://urho3d.github.io/documentation/1.5/_building.html

![sam](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3676827/16360154/db854fbc-3b83-11e6-9916-02f7fabe05c0.jpg)

data.title: SendEvent new renderpath command
data.body:
A new "sendevent" render path command can now be added. This render path command will send an E_RENDERPATHEVENT event with the specified name. This can be used to execute some code at a specific point during the rendering.

_<command type="sendevent" name="MyCustomName"/>_

Feel free to suggest me some changes to the names that i have used. Since English is not my native language some names may not be nice :)

data.title: Different materials for different LODs
data.body:
E.g. I have tree model that use Material 1 and 2 for first LODs. And the last LOD of this model is proxy billboard with Material 3. Is it possible to implement it in scope of StaticModel functionality?

Number of materials is equal to number of batches. Number of batches is equal to number of geometries. Geometries have LODs.
Soo... I can create three geometries. But it would be hard to link their LODs.

PS: Of course, I always can write my own StaticModel with blackjack and loods..

data.title: 'Resized scratch buffer to size' message floods the log.
data.body:
STR:
1. Open empty scene in editor
2. Add some light (must be visible to editor camera).
3. **DEBUG mode!**

Then log is flooded with tons of messages like 
`Resized scratch buffer to size 0`
`Resized scratch buffer to size 12`

'Log' means F1-console in editor.
I am worry that this could be a sign of some non-optimal reallocations...

**Update**: Huh, it doesn't reproduce so easy...
**Update 2**: Okay, you also must run Editor in Debug mode

data.title: Combine Texture subclasses into one class
data.body:
Currently there is a class for each type of texture (2D, 3D, cube, array). This leads to duplicated code and difficulty in rendering code where the type of the texture to be requested from the ResourceCache is not obvious. This leads to some guesswork or extra parameters needed in certain codepaths.

These issues could be overcome by merging the functionality into just one Texture class which can be initialized and loaded as the various types. This is a fairly large breaking change for applications so there's no hurry (definitely post 1.6 -release)

The SetData / GetData operations will possibly need a few overloads and not all are valid for all types of textures.

data.title: UIElement::SetDeepEnabled has incorrect implementation?
data.body:
The [UIElement header](https://github.com/urho3d/Urho3D/blob/master/Source/Urho3D/UI/UIElement.h#L271) says that `UIElement::SetDeepEnabled` remembers each element's enabled state so that it can be recalled with `UIElement::ResetDeepEnabled`. 

However, it looks like the [relevant line](https://github.com/urho3d/Urho3D/blob/master/Source/Urho3D/UI/UIElement.cpp#L853) is in fact inside the `UIElement::SetEnabledRecursive` method, not `UIElement::SetDeepEnabled`.

data.title: Physics components fail with zero quaternion
data.body: When I loaded a scene where some nodes had a 0 0 0 0 quaternion, the graphics would display fine but the physics components did not seem to work - there were no collisions, and the editor would not display the triangle mesh when the component/node was selected. This was with a triangle mesh static body, exported from Blender. Manually changing the quaternions to 1 0 0 0 fixed it.

data.title: Add update invisible parameter to RibbonTrail.
data.body: I'm adding update invisible parameter to Ribbon Trail so node can still emit trail even if it isn't visible to the camera. The default is off for optimization, but all trail on the samples are using it.

data.title: Add support of custom per-instance data in batches.
data.body:
Hi all.

These changes allow to set custom per-instance data in SourceBatch and implement things like smooth LOD switch.
https://github.com/urho3d/Urho3D/issues/1405

For now it it internal feature that can be used from Drawable derived-s.
So it is impossible to set these data from external code with public methods.
I just don't need such use case and have no ideas about good interface for it.

It could be settable property of `Drawable` like `Vector4 instancingData_[MAX]`, as suggested by **cadaver**, or something else.
I am not sure how much MAX should be. Now it is 4. I suppose it is enough for most cases. Is it enough? Is it okay to add extra 64 bytes for each drawable?
Where can I place this constant? Is `GraphicDefs.h` good place?

Custom per-instance data also does not work without instancing. I tried to implement it, but it requires extra uniform in all shaders and related changes, so I decided to do nothing.
I just added possibility to force instancing on for all render-ops. Could it break something?

Let's discuss..

data.title: API-agnostic graphics class headers
data.body:
Related to the discussion in https://github.com/urho3d/Urho3D/issues/1397, this proposes a change that just a one graphics API agnostic copy of public Graphics subdirectory header files (ie. Graphics.h, VertexBuffer.h, Texture2D.h ..) exists. 

This increases code maintainability and hides the actual graphics API choice inside the library so that a Urho library built using any graphics API should be interchangeable in applications. Some return values (Graphics::RGBAFormat() etc.) will still be API-dependent so their values should not be relied on in crossplatform applications.

This should also get rid of the issue that the generated documentation would be different depending on the graphics API.
